sen.e: Tawaramoto domain existed in Tawaramoto., Toichi-gun, Yamato Province (present-day Tawaramoto, Tawaramoto City, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture).

sen.e: Tawaramoto Domain existed in Tawaramoto, Toichi-gun, Yamato Province (present-day Tawaramoto, Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 田原本藩の藩主家は平野氏である。
sen.e: Tawaramoto domain was ruled by the Hirano clan.

sen.cmt: Domain 大文字にしました。
sen.e: Tawaramoto Domain was ruled by the Hirano clan.

sen.j: ただし、藩として正式に立藩したのは明治元年（1868年）7月14日、新政府の計らいによって1万石の大名として諸侯に列したものであり、いわば「維新立藩」によるものであった。
sen.e: However, it was founded officially on July 14, 1868, with Meiji Restoration, in the so-called "Restoration-founded domain" created by the new government to grant the clan 10,000-koku status.

However, it was founded officially on August 31, 1868 as the so-called 'domain founded by Meiji Restoration' at the discretion of the new government to grant the clan a status of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with the crop yield of 10,000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。維新立藩→'domain founded by Meiji Restoration' としました（定訳不明です）。全体的に表現を変更しました。石（koku) 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: However, it was founded officially on August 31, 1868 as the so-called 'domain founded by Meiji Restoration' at the discretion of the new government to grant the clan a status of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with the crop yield of 10,000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land).

sen.j: 平野氏の祖である平野長泰は豊臣秀吉に仕え、天正11年（1583年）の賤ヶ岳の戦いで戦功を挙げて加藤清正や福島正則らと並ぶ『賤ヶ岳七本槍』の一人となり、大和国内に5000石の知行を与えられた。
sen.e: Founder of the Hirano clan Nagayasu HIRANO served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, becoming one of the Seven Spears of Shiguzatake, alongside Kiyomata KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, for their military success in the 1583 Battle of Shizugatake and was awarded 5000-koku of rice in Yamato Province.

Founder of the Hirano clan Nagayasu HIRANO served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, becoming one of the "Seven Spears of Shizugatake," alongside Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, for their military success in the 1583 Battle of Shizugatake and was awarded a territory in Yamato Province with 5,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 人名を一部修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを追加しました。
sen.e: Founder of the Hirano clan Nagayasu HIRANO served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, becoming one of the "Seven Spears of Shizugatake," alongside Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, for their military success in the 1583 Battle of Shizugatake and was awarded a territory in Yamato Province with 5,000 koku.

sen.j: その後、長泰の表立った活躍はあまり見られないが、領内においては支配体制を固め、善政を敷き、特に領内における寺内町は「大和の大坂」と呼ばれ、大いなる賑わいを見せたという。
sen.e: Although Nagayasu did not make any major contributions subsequently, he solidified control of the domain, implemented benevolent rule and brought prosperity, with Terauchi-cho nicknamed "Osaka of Yamato."

sen.j: 長泰の死後、後を継いだ平野長勝は、陣屋の構築などに尽力している。
sen.e: After Nagayasu's death, his successor Nagakatsu HIRANO working on the construction of the family home.
After Nagayasu's death, his successor Nagakatsu HIRANO worked on the construction of the jinya (regional government office).
sen.cmt: 陣屋→regional government officeとしました。
sen.e: After Nagayasu's death, his successor Nagakatsu HIRANO worked on the construction of the jinya (regional government office).

sen.j: しかし小領主のため、次第に財政が悪化して、江戸時代中期以降は領民に御用金を課すことも少なくなかった。
sen.e: Due to the small size of the domain, however, financial conditions declined gradually, with Edo shogunate levy rarely instituted on its farmers from the middle of Edo Period.

Due to the small size of the domain, however, financial conditions gradually declined; from the middle of the Edo period onward goyokin (the money the government charged temporarily on farmers and merchants) was imposed on the people of the domain for a number of times.

sen.e: Due to the small size of the domain, however, financial conditions gradually declined; from the middle of the Edo period onward goyokin (the money the government charged temporarily on farmers and merchants) was imposed on the people of the domain for a number of times.

sen.j: 平野氏は9代にわたったが、実際に正式な藩主だった期間はわずか3年間であった。
sen.e: Hirano clan rule lasted for 9 generations, but the family remained official domain lord status for only 3 years.
Hirano clan rule lasted for nine generations, but it was only three years that the clan had the official status of domain lord.
